title: CRISPR repeat element detector
description: This feature specifically detects CRISPR repeat elements in bacterial genomes. The feature produces sharp, high-amplitude activation spikes precisely at CRISPR repeat locations. These repeats are critical components of CRISPR-Cas systems, which provide adaptive immunity against foreign genetic elements in bacteria and archaea. The consistent, specific activation pattern suggests the feature is detecting either a sequence motif common to CRISPR repeats or a distinctive structural characteristic of these elements. The feature shows remarkable specificity across multiple examples from different genomic contexts, making it a reliable detector of this important bacterial defense mechanism element.
